intro: Elatostema umbellatum var. yakusimense, commonly known as the Yakusim Island elatostema, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula and parts of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants commonly known as nettles. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in studies of plant taxonomy and ecological adaptations.
